description.narrative: By 2025, improved capacity of schools to effectively deliver the primary and lower secondary education curriculum, with a particular focus on disadvantaged woredas.

mailing-address.narrative: UNICEF House (Kazanchis - Opposite UNECA/German House) P.O. Box 1169 Addis Ababa

sector.narrative: Provision of multiple-levels (or alternative pathways of education) teacher training
Provision or procurement of early-learning / pre-primary education learning materials
System strengthening - gender-responsive teaching and learning (excluding SRGBV)
Technical assistance - Equitable access to quality education

title.narrative: UNICEF Programmes in Ethiopia (Learning and Development)
UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace
2019 Ethiopia: Formative evaluation of UNICEF Ethiopia Country Program Evaluation Report
Ethiopia 2019 Annual Report on Results for Children
Ethiopia Country Office 2020 Annual Report on Results for Children
UNICEF Tender Notices through the UN Global Marketplace

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2025, improved capacity of schools to effectively deliver the primary and lower secondary education curriculum, with a particular focus on disadvantaged woredas.
Indicator 3.1: Number of schools that have institutionalised regular classroom learning assessments (in UNICEF supported Woredas)

Service Delivery - Skills - Number of children who have participated in skills development programmes for learning, personal empowerment, active citizenship and/or employability through UNICEF-supported programmes
Indicator 3.2: Availability of a revised General Education Curriculum which mainstreams skill development within the national education system
